items.summary: The Federal Open Market Committee voted 10-2 to lower its policy rate to a range of 3.75% to 4.00%

items.summary: Microsoft's cloud revenue climbed 26 percent to $49.1 billion, underscoring robust enterprise demand for AI-powered services

items.title: Nomura expects no more Fed rate cuts in 2025 after October easing
items.summary: Nomura now anticipates the Federal Reserve will hold interest rates steady in December, reversing its prior expectation of a cut. This shift follows the Fed's recent quarter-point reduction aimed at supporting the job market. Nomura foresees three 25-basis point cuts in 2026, citing data that is unlikely to trigger renewed concerns about labor market deterioration.

items.title: Infosys, Wipro, other IT stocks fall  as US Fed says December rate cut is far from guaranteed
items.summary: Indian IT stocks dipped on Thursday after the US Federal Reserve signaled that a December rate cut was not guaranteed. While the Fed delivered a 25 basis point cut on Wednesday, Chair Powell's cautious tone tempered market expectations. Cognizant's raised revenue guidance provided some support, though its net profit fell due to a tax outgo.

items.title: Big Tech’s AI Bets: Mixed market reactions after Q3 earnings
items.summary: Alphabet, Microsoft, and Meta posted mixed Q3 earnings, highlighting AI’s dominance in Big Tech’s strategy. While revenues surged, soaring capital expenditure and one-time charges triggered varied market reactions.

items.title: Rs 20,000 crore value? How Lenskart IPO could shift market gaze to Tata's quietest business
items.summary: Titan, a retail giant, once aimed to lead India's eyewear market but its division now lags significantly behind Lenskart. Lenskart's tech-driven, omnichannel approach has made it a dominant player, highlighting Titan's traditional retail model's limitations. The upcoming Lenskart IPO may force a re-evaluation of Titan's eyewear business.

items.title: After Nvidia’s $5 trillion milestone, Jensen Huang races ahead of ex-Microsoft CEO, Dell founder—what is his net worth?
items.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang saw his net worth surge to nearly $180 billion following the company's $5 trillion market cap milestone, placing him ahead of Steve Ballmer and Michael Dell.&nbsp;

items.title: Quess Corp Q2FY26 PAT up 2% at ₹52 crore; headcount dips 5% amid steady revenue growth

items.title: Nifty, Sensex near record high: Is your stock portfolio feeling left out?
items.summary: While Nifty and Sensex near record highs, the broader market lags, with smallcaps still 6% from their peak. This rally is driven by select largecaps, particularly banks, while IT stocks struggle. Experts believe earnings derating is largely over, with small and mid-caps poised for faster growth, offering opportunities for patient investors.

items.title: NUS launches new Master’s programme to explore the geopolitics shaping South Asia’s future
items.summary: South Asia is at the center of a global power shift, redefining economics, trade, and diplomacy. The National University of Singapore's Master of Social Science in Geopolitics of South Asia offers a unique dual perspective to understand these evolving dynamics. This program equips students with interdisciplinary knowledge and practical insights for impactful careers.

items.summary: The LNG bunkering facility will support the nation’s clean energy ambitions, in line with global environmental regulations and India’s commitment to green port initiatives

items.title: Indian Oil to team up with Vitol in global trading push, source says
items.summary: Indian Oil is gearing up for a strategic alliance with international trader Vitol in the coming year. This collaboration, headquartered in Singapore, is designed to enhance Indian Oil's crude and fuel trading across global markets. By aligning with the strategies of leading oil firms, this partnership is poised to lower procurement expenses and explore new geographical opportunities.

items.summary: Prices in New York fell to 14.21 cents a pound before recovering slightly, marking a 25% decline this year.

items.title: Tough task: The 8th Pay Commission must bat for public capacity but within fiscal limits
items.summary: The latest pay panel has a tough task ahead of it now that its terms of reference have been set by the government. Fiscal caution is point No. 1 but India must enhance governance capacity. To get it right, the panel should put various aspects of public employment to close scrutiny.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | It’s not easy for the Fed to set monetary policy with a data blindfold
items.summary: With Washington in shutdown and key economic statistics missing, the US Federal Reserve has had to operate in near darkness. How well its October rate call works out, though, could be a matter of suspense for months.

items.title: GM layoffs: Auto major to cut 1,700 jobs, 5,500 employees to be laid off temporarily—who's affected?
items.summary: GM layoffs: General Motors will lay off 1,200 workers in Detroit and 550 in Ohio as it faces a slowdown in electric vehicle demand. The automaker is scaling back production and plans amid concerns over regulatory changes and the end of federal tax incentives for EV buyers.

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 30 Oct 2025: Sensex tanks 593 points hit by foreign fund outflows, uncertainty over Fed’s future rate cut path
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices Highlights: Equity markets fell sharply on Thursday, with the Sensex tumbling 592.67 points and the Nifty declining to 25,877.85 level, as fresh foreign fund outflows and no clarity on the future course of rate action by the US Federal Reserve dampened investors' sentiment.

The 30-share BSE Sensex tanked 592.67 points or 0.70 per cent to settle at 84,404.46. During the day, it dropped 684.48 points or 0.80 per cent to 84,312.65.

The 50-share NSE Nifty tumbled 176.05 points or 0.68 per cent to 25,877.85.

From the Sensex firms, Bharti Airtel, Power Grid, Tech Mahin

items.title: Groww eyes $7 billion valuation as IPO opens next week
items.summary: Groww, which counts 14.38 million active users, aims to use the proceeds to boost cloud infrastructure, invest in subsidiaries, and fund acquisitions as it competes with Zerodha and Angel One in India’s booming retail trading market.

items.title: Centre imposes 10% import duty, 20% additional cess on yellow pea imports ahead of kharif season
items.summary: The Centre has imposed a 30% total levy on yellow pea imports, comprising a 10% import duty and a 20% AIDC, effective November 1. This policy shift aims to support domestic pulse growers ahead of the kharif season, responding to farmer group concerns about cheap imports depressing local market prices.

items.summary: CPPIB, with global assets of about C$732 billion, has recently invested in the National Highways Infrastructure Trust, Kedaara Capital, and Accel Partners.

items.title: Sky-high gold prices, BlueStone IPO light a spark in India’s demi-fine jewellery market
items.summary: Consumers are increasingly seeing gold as just an investment and splurging on mid-tier jewellery instead, prompting venture capitalists to swoop in on the nascent segment.

items.title: No more disclosure overload: Reporting relief on the way for unlisted firms
items.summary: Reliance Industries has dozens of unlisted companies. TCS has about seven in India. Preparing financial statements for the unlisted subsidiaries with the same rigour as for the listed parent takes time and effort. Now, ICAI is bringing in Ind AS (119), which will help them breathe easier.

items.title: Caramel popcorn, peach sorbet, even masala chai… Beauty brands turn foodies to woo your nose, imagined tastes
items.summary: Nostalgia and novelty drives Gen-Z consumers to pick up personal care items with vanilla, coffee, grape, and similar fragrances that remind them of comfort foods. A bevy of new brands leads growth in the so-called gourmand beauty segment market.

items.title: Nvidia hits $5 trillion valuation, extends AI market dominance
items.summary: Shares rose 3.1% to $207.16 as CEO Jensen Huang announced new partnerships with Samsung, Hyundai and Nokia, while dismissing AI bubble fears.

items.title: Fed cuts rates; Powell says December move ‘far from’ certain
items.summary: The Fed voted 10-2 to lower the policy rate to 3.75%-4% and announced it will stop shrinking its balance sheet from December 1.

items.title: Groaning under the wait: From chocolates to TVs, companies scramble to meet explosive demand
items.summary: Festive cheer has turned into a supply chain scramble. Consumers face waiting periods for electronics and cars. Manufacturers are working overtime to meet unexpected demand. Chocolates, soft drinks, and large appliances are flying off shelves. Companies did not anticipate the spike in demand. Normalcy in supplies is expected in 15 to 45 days.

items.title: Government proposes new scheme for restructuring power distribution utilities with private participation
items.summary: The government is preparing a new plan to reform power distribution companies. This plan may involve selling a part of the stake to private partners and restructuring existing debt. States could receive financial support for capital projects. To qualify, states will need to allow private sector involvement in their distribution networks.

items.title: Citibank to boost investment in India as firms eye global expansion: Viswas Raghavan
items.summary: Citibank plans to significantly increase its capital deployment in India as it broadens its focus on the country. Viswas Raghavan, Citi's head of banking, highlighted that Indian companies are increasingly pursuing international deals, and Citi is poised to support these ambitions with both advice and capital.

items.title: Alphabet’s Q3 revenue surges to $102.35 billion as AI demand fuels growth across Google’s advertising and Cloud units
items.summary: Alphabet beats expectations with third quarter revenue of $102.35 billion, driven by strong demand for AI-powered cloud and advertising services. The company raised its 2025 capital spending forecast to as much as $93 billion to support expansion in AI infrastructure.

items.title: Microsoft posts strong quarter as revenue rises 18% to $77.7 billion, net profit jumps 22%
items.summary: The results came a day after a new deal with OpenAI pushed Microsoft to $4 trillion in valuation for the second time this year

items.title: Meta’s Q3 profit plunges on $16 billion one-time tax charge related to Trump's Big Beautiful Bill
items.summary: Meta reported a nearly $16 billion one-time charge linked to President Trump’s “Big Beautiful Bill,” slashing its reported net income to $2.71 billion.

items.title: U.S. Fed cuts interest rates, nods to limits of data during shutdown; two policymakers dissent
items.summary: Fed, as expected, cuts interest rates by 25 basis points; policy decision made in the absence of key government data

items.summary: Lenskart will make its debut on the stock exchanges on November 10

items.title: Target Zoom Glitch Added to Series of Mishaps Over Job Cuts
items.summary: Target Corp. corporate employees logged onto a company Zoom meeting Tuesday morning to learn if they were among the 1,000 people that the retailer last week announced would lose their jobs.

items.title: US, Singapore accounted for 1/3rd of FDI in FY25: RBI
items.summary: The US and Singapore collectively contributed over a third of India's Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in 2024-25, as per the Reserve Bank of India's latest census. Other significant sources of FDI included Mauritius, the UK, and the Netherlands. The census covered cross-border liabilities and assets of Indian entities.

items.title: Federal health officials push effort to spur cheaper biotech drugs
items.summary: Federal health officials push effort to spur cheaper biotech drugs

items.title: Desi shipbuilders plan to augment local sourcing of key components
items.summary: Indian shipbuilders are boosting local component sourcing. This aligns with the government's 'Make in India' initiative for the maritime sector. Companies like Goa Shipyard and Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders aim for high localization. This strategy supports a significant package for the shipping industry. The focus is on strengthening domestic manufacturing capabilities for naval vessels and commercial ships.

items.title: Consumption gap seen across UP districts: Report
items.summary: A new study uncovers significant variations in spending habits throughout Uttar Pradesh's districts. Shrawasti and Gautam Buddha Nagar lead the way in monthly per capita consumption expenditure in rural areas, while Mirzapur and Chandauli remain at the lower end of the spectrum. Urban districts mirror this trend, with Gautam Buddha Nagar shining brightly and Ghazipur trailing behind.

items.title: Coastal growth & blue economy priority for 25 years: PM Modi
items.summary: India will focus on the blue economy and sustainable coastal development for the next 25 years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted plans for green logistics, port connectivity, and shipbuilding. Indian ports are now among the most efficient globally. Reduced turnaround and dwell times are making them more attractive for international shipping. India aims to strengthen global supply chain resilience.

items.title: Half of EU FTA deal wrapped up: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India and the European Union are nearing a free trade agreement. Negotiations have concluded 10 chapters, with more broadly decided. Sensitive issues like steel and automobiles require further discussion. Both sides aim for a balanced pact, recognizing mutual strengths. The EU trade commissioner's visit in November is expected to bring further breakthroughs.

items.title: Coal ministry puts up 41 mines for auction
items.summary: India's coal ministry is auctioning 41 mines, including 21 for underground coal gasification. This move aims to convert deep coal into syngas, reducing pollution and natural gas imports. The government targets 100 million tonnes of coal gasification by 2030. This initiative is expected to attract significant investment and create jobs, contributing to India's economic growth and a hydrogen economy.

items.title: At Rs 1.92 lakh crore, fertiliser subsidy bill for FY26 may be 15% more than BE
items.summary: India's fertilizer subsidy bill is projected to reach ₹1.92 lakh crore this financial year. This increase stems from higher global prices for urea and diammonium phosphate, coupled with a dip in domestic production. The government aims to ensure farmers receive adequate fertilizer, shielding them from international price hikes.

items.title: Mittal-HPCL JV halts Russian oil purchases after fresh sanctions
items.summary: HMEL has stopped buying Russian oil due to new Western sanctions. The company stated it cannot confirm past deliveries involving sanctioned ships. HMEL buys crude on a delivered-at-port basis. This means they are unaware of earlier transport details. Top refiners Indian Oil and Reliance Industries are also complying with sanctions.

items.title: Revised ethics code to allow auditors to showcase services; ICAI also suggests fresh guidelines on audit independence
items.summary: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India is set to significantly update its Code of Ethics. New rules will allow auditors and their firms to advertise more freely and develop websites to showcase services. Stricter guidelines on audit independence are also proposed, aiming to reduce conflicts of interest for listed companies.

items.title: Telcos begin pilot runs of 'calling name presentation' feature in one circle
items.summary: Telecom operators are piloting a new feature called Calling Name Presentation. This will allow users to see a caller's name on incoming calls. The Department of Telecom expects this service to be available across India by March 31, 2026. This initiative aims to combat fraud and cybercrime by using verified caller information.

items.title: Bizman buys four flats at DLF’s The Dahlias for Rs 380 crore in record deal
items.summary: An industrialist has acquired four interconnected apartments at DLF's The Dahlias for nearly Rs 380 crore, marking one of the country's most expensive apartment deals. This transaction, totaling over 35,000 sq ft, highlights Gurugram's rising real estate prices, now rivaling and sometimes exceeding prime Mumbai locations. The project has seen significant sales, with prices appreciating by 50% since its launch.

items.title: Nissan CEO Ivan Espinosa drives global overhaul, bets big on India
items.summary: Nissan is set for a major comeback in India. CEO Ivan Espinosa is spearheading a global overhaul, with India playing a crucial role. The company plans to launch three new models starting early 2026. This move aims to boost sales beyond the Magnite SUV. Nissan is also exploring collaborations with Honda for software and vehicle development.

items.title: Nissan CEO Ivan Espinosa drives global overhaul, bets big on India

items.title: Mobile verification platform to boost telcos revenues
items.summary: The government is gearing up to introduce a revolutionary platform that enables banks and financial providers to validate mobile numbers effectively. This initiative is a proactive measure aimed at curbing online frauds, especially phishing attacks. Each verification request will see telecom operators earning a fee, creating a win-win situation.

items.title: Microsoft admits configuration error caused worldwide Azure outage — Are services back?
items.summary: Microsoft confirmed that a configuration change error triggered a major outage on October 29, disrupting Azure, Microsoft 365, Outlook, Xbox Live, and Copilot worldwide. The company has begun deploying a “last known good” configuration to restore services, with early signs of recovery reported.

items.title: $21 bn & counting: CPPIB's India game moving at a faster click
items.summary: CPP Investments' India portfolio has tripled to nearly $21 billion. India is now its third-largest Asian market. The fund is exploring new infrastructure like green ammonia and EVs. CPP Investments is focused on long-term fundamentals. It sees significant opportunities in India's dynamic economy. The fund aims to deliver strong returns and build lasting partnerships.

items.title: India to impose duty on import of yellow peas from Nov 1
items.summary: The levy, 10% basic duty and 20% AIDC , being reinstated after December 2023 will help farmers get better returns

items.title: HCL co-founder Ajai Chowdhry urges adopting "demand aggression" model for Made in India push
items.summary: In a dynamic push for India's tech sector, Ajai Chowdhry, co-founder of HCL, champions the idea of demand aggregation for telecom and networking solutions. His call for the government to consolidate and award major contracts to top-tier Indian companies mirrors the successful model of China's Huawei.

items.title: India's soybean meal exports fall by 11% due to high prices
items.summary: Indian soybean meal exports have experienced a notable decline, with international demand waning by 11 percent during the oil marketing year 2024-25. The primary contributor to this downturn is the elevated pricing compared to global rivals. Germany, France, Nepal, Bangladesh, and Kenya led the charge in imports, showcasing shifting dynamics that could affect India's standing in the international market.

items.title: Founders of these $100 million startups all have a Delhi school's computer science club in common — can you guess?
items.summary: Deedy Das, partner at Menlo Ventures noted that founders of over $100 million valuation companies, including Snapdeal, boAt, Sugar Cosmetics, and Cartesia, were all members DPS RK Puram's computer science club, called Exun Clan.

items.summary: LIC Housing Finance reported a 2% increase in Q3 net profit to  ₹1,354 crore, with total income rising to  ₹7,170 crore. NPAs improved, reducing to 2.51%, while liquidity coverage ratio fell to 185.86%. Consolidated profit also saw a 1.5% rise to  ₹1,349 crore.

Microsoft Azure down: What caused the outage? Which services are affected?

items.summary: Cognizant – which follows a January-December financial year– had posted a net income of $582 million in Q3 2024

items.summary: The biggest global health crisis in a century continues to flare unabated with cases rising in India, Great Britain, Spain and several parts of the United States, where the infection rate has not come under control for months.

items.title: Gold flat as dollar strength counters safe-haven demand
items.summary: Spot gold was little changed at $1,929.30 per ounce by 0038 GMT, after falling to a near two-week week low of $1,906.24 on Tuesday.

items.title: Gold may witness choppy trade, expect buying at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: After weeks of consolidation, crude oil has come under pressure amid signs of correction in US equity market and gains in US dollar index.

items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
